I never call anyone bad /  Sht / And so on. But calling someone a troll because they went 0/11 isn't okay either?

{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

Consider this though. Why would dishonourable behaviour get you honour rewards? You obviously don't think your chat is all that severe, and certainly we've all seen worse, but that doesn't change *your* behaviour.

A complete honour drop may be a bit harsh, but we also don't have the full story as other players. Maybe you trolled for a bit in game, or maybe you have a long history of fairly mundane or inconsistent negativity and this was just the final straw that actually got you punished. Without that information we can only speculate.

Either way, even with only neutral behaviour it doesn't take that long to climb back through the honour levels, and given the timing you have the whole season to accomplish that. This punishment, and the honour drop that comes with it should be prompting you to look at your behaviour and work back towards being honourable.

If you're struggling to shrug off other people's less than savoury behaviour when it shows itself then just mute all when you get into game for a while, or just mute at the first sign of it and make a note to report it. You can communicate just about everything with pings now.

Not to mention that unlike last season you are now guaranteed to get either Grey Warwick or Medieval Twitch when you hit honour 5, instead of just having a tiny chance at them in every capsule.
We need a tribunal so people like myself who aren't sensitive little bitches can not deem this as a punishable offense. Anyone else who says otherwise harden the fuck up
